countryQuotes.name: United States
countryQuotes.quote: TestEach year, at least 14,500 people are trafficked into the U.S. and forced into slavery.

countryQuotes.name: Cote d'Ivoire
countryQuotes.quote: In 1860, slaves cost today's equivalent of $40,000.  Today they cost on average $90.

countryQuotes.name: India
countryQuotes.quote: Millions of bonded labor slaves from the "Dalit" class are saddled with bogus debts they can never work off.

countryQuotes.name: Russia Federation
countryQuotes.quote: Russia has the largest incidence of slavery in Europe.  Forced labour and commercial sex exploitation are the most common forms here.

countryQuotes.name: Indonesia
countryQuotes.quote: In 2015, The Indonesian government rescued more than 2,000 men off a remote island village of Benjina; some of these men had been at sea for years, and they had been held captive on fishing boats as unpaid slave labor.

countryQuotes.name: Mali
countryQuotes.quote: "When people eat chocolate, they are eating my flesh." - Mali Chocolate Farm Slave
